title: Dinka Ciec [South Central Dinka]
title_vernacular: Wel puat̤ ci Mak ke gor 1916
description: South Central Dinka is also known as Aliap, Ciëc, Chich, Jang, Gok, and Agar. Mark was translated into the Ciec dialect of Dinka by C.A. Lea-Wilson, and revised by H.F. Davies, both of the Church Missionary Society (CMS). It was published in London by the British and Foreign Bible Society (BFBS) in 1916. The text was digitised from an original copy in the British and Foreign Bible Society archives.

links.title: Wel puat̤ ci Mak ke gor 1916

language.name: South Central Dinka
language.area: South, west of the Nile, south of the Sudd. Aker is southeast of Agar; Aliap south of Bor [dks] in fishing villages mainly on Nile east bank; Ciec in Lakes District on Nile west bank; Gok between Agar and Rek [dik] in Jur River and Lakes districts.
